c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:10): if a page has a .manifest file, should the UA check for a new version of each content file on load? If not, when should it?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:11): only when the manifest changes
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:12): so how would I designate that a file had been updated?
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:12): (i.e. a .js file with a new version)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:12): you change the manifest
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:12): e.g. change a comment or do something like foo.js?v=2
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:12): or add whitespace?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:13): could work
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:13): we can make it more complicated later
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:13): suggestion: allow a .manifest to include last-modified datetimes for each file
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:13): that would be complicated
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:13): so the UA can figure out if it should grab a new rev
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:14): until then, I can't use manifests for my webapps/widgets/etc
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:14): why?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:14): you can just print the timestamp as comment, no?
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:15): yeah, but then it'd grab a new version of every file for every load
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:15): the server can return 304 like it can normally
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:15): defeats the purpose
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:15): if your file changes all the time you should prolly not put it in the manifest
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:16): no, I'm debugging
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:16): and I'll end up updating it to make new versions
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:19): you know, mantinence, new features...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:20): sure
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:20): so add manifest when most of the other stuff is done
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:20): I don't really see the problem here
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:22): the manifest file could be generated by a script, or just manually edited, so it include last-modified dates for each file in it
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:22): so when offline, the UA uses its cached versions of everything
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:22): and when online, it just checks the manifest against its stored manifest
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:22): to see if there's a new version of anything
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:22): yeah, I just told you you can do that
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:22): if there is, it just downloads THAT file
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:23): otherwise, it keeps using its cached version
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:23): it doesn't download the whole file anyway
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (22:23): the whole cached entity, or the whole .manifest?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:23): the former
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:24): it just does a request and the server can say 304
